title: Rev-head's dream! Home on Mt Panorama with unrestricted views of the track to go under the hammer
text:
An opulent property on Mount Panorama with prime viewing for the Bathurst 1000 V8 race has been put on the market.

The address at 448 Conrod Straight hasn't been listed for sale in 33 years, and features 288 meters of unrestricted viewing of the course's famous straight.

Professional drivers in the big race will hit speeds near 300km/h on the edge of the 36-hectare property, which includes a main house with three brick veneer cottages.

448 Conrod Straight in Mount Panorama (pictured) has been put on the market

The residence (pictured) is the largest privately-owned block on Mount Panorama and has been a bed and breakfast for the last 22 years

Mount Panorama (pictured) is the track that hosts the famous Bathurst 1000 V8 Supercar race

The estate is named Lochinvar, and features a large workshop, with the owners saying there is immense potential for a hospitality development on site.

'If you miss out you miss out,' Ray White Emms Mooney agent Louise Ireland told RealEstate.com.

The residence is the largest privately-owned block on Mount Panorama and has been a bed and breakfast for the last 22 years.

'It truly is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity and there is nothing like this property on or near the track.'

The property will be auctioned on November 22.

The residence features a main house (pictured) with three brick veneer cottages

The address features 288 meters of unrestricted viewing of Conrod Straight (pictured)
description: An opulent property on Conrod Straight at Mount Panorama with prime viewing for the Bathurst 100 has been put on the market.
authors: Jackson Barron For Daily Mail Australia
